alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 05 at 9:30PM CDT until August 05 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR EASTERN ROOKS AND OSBORNE COUNTIES... At 924 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Woodston to 6 miles southwest of Natoma, moving east at 50 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR CODELL AND NATOMA HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. At 916 PM CDT 77 MPH winds were measured 9 miles north northeast of Codell in Rooks County. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. These severe storms will be over primarily rural areas of east central Rooks County and southern Osborne County but may extend south into Natoma. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across rural east central Rooks and rural central and southern Osborne Counties. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
